sentences.english: Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 应当向他唱新歌，弹得巧妙，声音洪亮。

sentences.english: There is a sonorous bell in the tower.
The hussars thronged about him and responded by a loud shout in unison.
sentences.chinese: 骠骑兵们都聚集起来，一齐用洪亮的喊声回报。

sentences.english: We listened to a rich voice which rolled out into the dusk.
sentences.chinese: 我们静听暮色苍茫中响起的一个圆润洪亮的声音。

sentences.english: He must be an actor.His voice carries so well.
sentences.chinese: 他一定是个演员，他的声音很洪亮。

sentences.english: The sonorous voice of the speaker echoed round the hall.
sentences.chinese: 演说者洪亮的声音在大厅内回荡。

sentences.english: The loudest part of the storm moved away from us across the desert.
sentences.chinese: 雷暴雨的最洪亮的部分已经穿过了沙漠，离我们而去。

sentences.english: The sonorous voice of the speaker echoed round the room.
sentences.chinese: 那位演讲人洪亮的声音在室内回荡。

sentences.english: His voice pealed out from the next room.
sentences.chinese: 隔壁传来了他的洪亮的声音。

sentences.english: The man has a loud voice.
Speak clearly and loudly enough for all to hear. Do not speak in a monotone voice.
sentences.chinese: 发音清晰，声音洪亮，保证所有人都能够听到。

sentences.english: Sing to him a new song; play skillfully, and shout for joy.
sentences.chinese: 应当向他唱新歌，弹得巧妙，声音洪亮。

sentences.english: What ever I said , Wang Hongliang would disagree.
sentences.chinese: 我无论说什么王洪亮都不同意。

sentences.english: The church bells are pealing the message of Christmas joy.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的钟声洪亮地传颂着圣诞快乐的信息。

sentences.english: He got the part simply'cos of his loud voice.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了一次演出的机会仅仅是因为他的声音洪亮。

definition: high-pitched and penetrating (musical instrument, voice etc)/high-spirited/fever-pitched (atmosphere)
sharp and clear/crisp/melodious/ringing/tinkling/silvery (of sound)/fragile/frail/also written 輕脆|轻脆
